climbs.name: Smokey and the Bandit
climbs.fa: Unknown if there was an FA prior to MountainManny sending

content.description:
SDS on the lower inside right of the cave...just below where "

Over the Rainbow

" ends. Because of how heavily soot filled the cave is from fires, the line is extremely obvious. Chalk mixes nicely with the soot, it is not messy or slick.

Moving up the wall from your SDS...take the amazingly aesthetic roof line to the lip of the cave....there are lots of holds and great compression climbing to the lip.

Bomber holds on the lip await you and give you the chance to drop your feet and re-position for a kick up to a heel hook on to the right side of the cave lip. Trending to the left of the cave on the lip you will be looking for a ladder like set of crimpers that are to the right of the crux for "

Over The Rainbow

". Commit and make the throw to the crimpers to topout on the 4th class ledge. This is very committing...incredibly fun, it is the "To Do" problem at this crag.
content.protection: Spotters and pads...it has a pretty nasty landing below the lip when you are pulling the roof. I took some serious shit eating falls on working this problem with just 1 spotter and 1 pad.
content.location: It is inside the cave...on the far right.

content.description: This route starts on the left side dihedral then goes across the roof and ends back on the ground.

Go straight up the left dihedral to a ledge about 25 feet up. The crux is only about 15 feet up, so if you don't make it, you only fall 10 feet. Once you climb to the top of the ledge, scramble on the ledge 4th class for about 100 feet and jump off about a 4 foot drop to the ground.
